page.title: 08INDUSTRY: POTTON TIMBER CO.
page.content: { In 1964 Potton Timber Engineering {Company}started in Willow Road, Potton, as a casemaking jobbing factory in an old foundry. After about five years the company moved to Sandy in order to expand. Fifty people work {at the Potton Timber Engineering site in Sandy, about eighty at the{timber {yard in Great Gransden}which supplies the Sandy company, forty people in the newly built{offices in Potton,}six at {Trianon, Potton}and eight at{Trianon, {Basildon.}The site in Sandy is used for building timber framed houses, bungalows and motel units. At the timber yard in Great Gransden they make timber framed panels for ninety houses a week, using spruce, pine and fir. In the future the company hopes to do more work for the leisure industry.
